content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-039-06-A |Item_parent=Medical assistance for procreation: the main biological, medical and ethical aspects |Item_parent_short=Medical assistance in procreation: the main biological, medical and ethical aspects |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the main causes of female and male infertility requiring recourse to MAP |Description=None |Rubric=Etiologies |Contributors=Patricia Fauque,Fabrice Guerif,Charlotte Sonigo,Geoffroy Robin,Pierre-Emmanuel Bouet,Stéphanie Huberlant,Nathalie Rives |Order=6}} The main indications for recourse to MAP include : *reproductive pathologies (see LISA 38) ''It should be noted that infertility may turn out to be unexplained (idiopathic) at the time of the work-up, and will nevertheless be managed by MAP''. *the risk of ''transmission of a particularly serious genetic pathology'' (recourse to pre-implantation diagnosis will then be proposed) *the risk of "transmitting a viral pathology" (to avoid transmitting a viral disease to the other member of the couple, mainly HIV) *the fulfilment of a ''parental project'' of a female couple or an unmarried woman *fertility preservation (medical or non-medical indications)".

question.title: What is one of the main indications for recourse to Medical Assistance for Procreation (MAP)?

option_a.title: A genetic disorder in one of the parents
option_a.description: A genetic disorder in one of the parents

option_b.title: A viral disease transmission risk
option_b.description: A risk of transmitting a viral disease to the other partner

option_c.title: Unexplained infertility
option_c.description: Infertility that may be unexplained at the time of the work-up

option_d.title: A parental project for a single woman
option_d.description: A parental project for a female couple or an unmarried woman

correct_option.title: C
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct option
